thread.title: CBeebies Land Hotel opens at Alton Towers in July - find out more about what's inside
thread.title_full: CBeebies Land Hotel opens at Alton Towers in July - find out more about what's inside

author: Emma Gill
title: CBeebies Land Hotel opens at Alton Towers in July - find out more about what's inside
text:
Get What's On   Thank you for subscribing!   
The much anticipated CBeebies Land Hotel is opening its doors at Alton Towers in July and more details of what's inside have now been revealed. 
It's the first hotel of its kind, created exclusively for children and young families and will feature a jam-packed entertainment schedule running from 7am until 9.30pm each day. 
Back in November its character rooms were unveiled with themes including In the Night Garden, Octonauts, Postman Pat, Swashbuckle and Something Special. Read More Tom Hardy is back with another CBeebies Bedtime Story - on Valentine's Day 
And now, as the building work steps up a gear, those behind the plans have been revealing more about the activities the hotel will offer. 
As well as giving kids a chance to fully immerse themselves in some of their favourite TV shows, there will be daily bedtime stories and treasure hunts, plus the chance to meet some of their favourite CBeebies characters such as Postman Pat and Bing. Read More Dads change nappies too - when they can find somewhere in Manchester to do it 
Each room will have its own separate kids zone, complete with TVs showing nothing but children’s favourites, and special areas for drawing and playing – along with regular meet and greets happening all over the hotel for fans to get close to their heroes. 
This week a small group of children visited the site to give feedback on what will make the hotel more exciting and were met by Justin Fletcher and Igglepiggle. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
